user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CloseAllFiles:
```c
int32 OS_CloseAllFiles(void)
{
    int32            return_code;
    int32            close_code;
    OS_object_iter_t iter;

    return_code = OS_SUCCESS;

    OS_ObjectIdIterateActive(LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, &iter);

    while (OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(&iter))
    {
        /* call OS_close() on the entry referred to by the iterator */
        close_code = OS_ObjectIdIteratorProcessEntry(&iter, OS_FileIteratorClose);
        if (close_code != OS_SUCCESS)
        {
            return_code = close_code;
        }
    }

    OS_ObjectIdIteratorDestroy(&iter);

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
while (OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(&iter))
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The call OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(&iter) passes a pointer to a local iterator object. Rule 8.13 requires pointers to point to const-qualified types only when possible; in this case the iterator is presumably advanced/modified by GetNext, so a non-const pointer is appropriate. (It would be a violation only if OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext does not modify the iterator and its parameter could be declared as const OS_object_iter_t *.)
